channel.title: briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Hundreds of thousands without power in the U.S. after a powerful winter storm
item.description: A powerful winter storm walloped a huge swath of the U.S., killing at least 18 people. Electricity is out for hundreds of thousands, and freezing rain...

item.title: Minnesota officials rebuff DOJ's data demands after latest shooting by federal agents
item.description: Minnesota officials are rebuffing demands from U.S. Attorney General Pam Bondi, as the state continues its clash with the Trump administration over th...

item.title: Ukrainians are sharing hacks online on how to survive winter power cuts
item.description: After repeated Russian attacks on Ukraine's energy grid, Ukrainians face long outages during a cold winter at war. On social media, Ukrainians share t...

item.title: Israel has recovered the final hostage remains from Gaza
item.description: The Israeli military says the body of Ran Gvili, a 24-year-old special forces policeman killed while fighting Hamas militants on Oct. 7, 2023, has bee...

item.title: As U.S. Warships Get Closer, Iran Ramps Up Threats to Retaliate
item.description: Iran and its militia allies say they will respond aggressively in the region if attacked. A U.S. aircraft carrier and warships are approaching the reg...

item.title: On Venezuela and Greenland, Many Trump Fans Give Him the Benefit of the Doubt
item.description: At least so far, President Trump has managed to bring along even those conservative supporters who are skeptical of foreign interventions.

item.title: Treasury cancels Booz Allen contracts over leaks about wealthy taxpayers
item.description: A Booz Allen contractor had leaked confidential tax information that showed how wealthy people like Donald Trump, Elon Musk and Jeff Bezos manage to m...

item.title: Israel Recovers Body of Ran Gvili From Gaza, Closing a Chapter
item.description: The recovery of Master Sgt. Ran Gvili’s body paves the way for the next stage of the Gaza cease-fire plan, though the path forward is unclear.

item.description: The recovery of Master Sgt. Ran Gvili’s body paves the way for the next stage of the Gaza cease-fire plan, though the path forward is unclear.

item.title: 430,000-Year-Old Wooden Tools Are the Oldest Ever Found
item.description: The finding, along with the discovery of a 500,000-year-old hammer made of bone, indicates that our human ancestors were making tools even earlier tha...

item.title: Thousands of Flights Canceled Monday After Snowstorm
item.description: Delays and cancellations persisted a day after more than 11,000 flights were canceled. Airports in the Northeastern U.S. were hit the hardest.

item.title: The Taliban Say They’re Ready to Release U.S. Prisoners. But Which Ones?

item.title: Why Gen Z Doesn’t Love ‘Harry Potter’
Winter Storm Pummels Toronto With Record Snowfall
item.description: Canada’s biggest city got roughly 22 inches, and giant snow banks are unlikely to melt soon because of colder than usual temperatures.
